snippet: If engineers cannot restore a mechanism that keeps the Kepler spacecraft’s telescope pointed, one of the most romantic and successful of NASA’s missions could end.
abstract: NASA's planet-hunting Kepler spacecraft is shut down by failure of reaction wheel used to keep it pointed; one of space agency's most romantic and successful missions could end if engineers cannot restore mechanism; Kepler searches for Earth-like planets in habitable orbits around other stars.
lead_paragraph: If engineers cannot restore a mechanism that keeps the Kepler spacecraft’s telescope pointed, one of the most romantic and successful of NASA’s missions could end.

headline.seo: Equipment Failure Imperils Kepler’s Quest for Other Earths
headline.main: Breakdown Imperils NASA’s Hunt for Other Earths
headline.print_headline: Breakdown Imperils Kepler’s Hunt for Other Earths
